# Examples

This page shows simple demonstrations of how to use the main functions/classes in `latlonghelper`.

---

## LatLongDistance

```python
from latlonghelper.lat_long_distance import LatLongDistance

latitude_1, longitude_1 = 40.7128, -74.0060  # New York
latitude_2, longitude_2 = 34.0522, -118.2437 # Los Angeles

distance = LatLongDistance(latitude_1, longitude_1, latitude_2, longitude_2)
print("Distance (km):", distance)
```

---

## LatLongBinning

```python
from latlonghelper.lat_long_binning import LatLongBinning

latitude, longitude = 49.2593, -123.2475

binned_cell = LatLongBinning(latitude, longitude)
print("Binned cell:", binned_cell)
```

---

## PlotBinnedLatLong

```python
from latlonghelper.plot_binned_lat_long import PlotBinnedLatLong
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

binned_data = ['49.25_-123.25', '49.25_-123.25', '49.26_-123.24', '49.25_-123.25']

ax = PlotBinnedLatLong(binned_data)

plt.show()
```
